𓊹𓊹𓊹 Dryhten "Lord" From Proto-Germanic *druhtinaz. Cognate with Old Frisian drochten, Old Saxon drohtin, Old High German truhtin, Old Norse dróttinn. *druhtiz band of troop, "director" drag duce ≠ *dʰrewgʰ Trug

* 𓅝 Thoth ⋍ Truth :
* Married to Ma'at Math/Wahrheit
* Consort / Daughter 𓋇 𓏏 Seshat 𓁐 𓋴 𓈙 𓄿 𓏏 𓅆 ⇔ Sophie she who scrivens / scribes
* Pet 𓃀 𓈖 𓏏 𓏮 𓃻 baboons 𓊵

He was the god of the moon 𓃷, wisdom, writing, hieroglyphs, science, magic, art, and judgment.

His Greek equivalent is Hermes ⋍ قَمَر qamar (moon)
